Walk into any neonatology department at your local hospital and you'll see a whole host of individuals scurrying around with plenty of tasks to get done. Just by the very nature of the occupants of the neonatal department there always seems to be something for workers to do. In case you don't know, the neonatal department is where babies are born and newborn babies with illnesses are cared for. It is one of the most important departments in your local hospital.
The median salary for a person who is licensed as a nurse practitioner is $75,000 a year. These professionals do most of the things a Physician's Assistant can do and some things that a PA can't. A nurse practitioner can do physical exams, order and read test results, make a diagnosis and prescribe medications (under the authority of a physician). They are highly skilled medical professionals who have taken the craft of nursing as far as it will go. Nurse Practitioners who have practiced at a hospital or clinic have the potential to make a 6 figure income within 5 years of service.
